Job_Title: Talent Acquisition Partner - Senior Business Recruiter
Job_Descriptions: About Us Xendit is the home of honey badgers (our spirit animal); people who have grit, support each other through any sorts of challenges, and are humble. Our people are our heart, and they need to be happy, feel heard, grow and stay committed to Xendit’s vision, to fuel our success. Our Talent Acquisition Team is the cultural guardian, ensuring we’re finding the right people and that our customers - internal (hiring teams) and external (candidates) - are well looked after. We’re looking for someone who is truly a people person. We have an incredibly high bar for our Talent Team as you will be the face of Xendit and represent our very human approach to hiring. As a true partner to the organisation, you genuinely thrive on solving problems - whether it’s recruiting, people, process or systems related. You will have a diverse set of skills: an exceptional conversationalist, tech savvy, can be both strategic and do the dirty work behind the scenes all the while being creative with solutions. You are relentless in your drive for successful outcomes - whether you’re recruiting for 30 roles or 70! As a Senior Business Recruiter you will be particularly strong in sourcing and engaging with senior talent and will be working with regional senior leadership and executives across (but not limited to) these orgs: Growth, Sales & Marketing, Finance, Legal, HR, Risk & Compliance, Professional Services, IT, Special Projects. You will be most impactful in the hiring of our next wave of leaders as we double down on our growth this year. What you will be doing Be the trusted Talent Partner ensuring a seamless and high touch recruitment experience for hiring managers, interviewers and candidates. Own the end to end recruitment process with pride and ensure we hire not only the best, but the right talent for Xendit. You are an exceptional communicator You are inquisitive and not afraid to ask the right questions to ensure you have what you need to execute You are great at storytelling to candidates understand the opportunity they’re exploring and vouch for our culture You respond at lightspeed and have excellent prioritisation skills, able to juggle multiple initiatives and needs effectively You build and maintain relationships effortlessly: gain trust and credibility easily with your hiring teams and candidates You are structured in your thinking and have a framework-driven approach to recruitment: reinvent and adapt our recruiting process for the business teams, eg. where it can be improved, and where it will deliver the highest impact You are well attuned to sourcing the right talent You have proven capability to source and close senior candidates (strong IC’s, through to C-suite level) in critical roles across but not limited to, Growth, Sales & Marketing, Finance, Legal, HR, Risk & Compliance You are highly resourceful: able to deliver if LinkedIn is not an option and constantly experimenting with new channels of talent acquisition You are a natural networker: nurture relationships with key talent pools across all of Asia (SEA especially) for short-term and long-term needs Be a true partner: make the lives of your hiring teams easier, support them in execution in any way possible Take ownership: push hiring teams to adhere to process when it counts, be adaptable when this needs iteration Achieve a deep understanding of the role requirements and ideal candidates - and only put the most suitable candidates in front of the hiring managers You are also prepared to Take on admin: scheduling and coordinating interviews, getting interview feedback from hiring managers, posting of job advertisements Own and participate in regional and global projects such as employer branding, ATS optimization, and operational effectiveness Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed What you will need At least 6-7 years of recruitment experience, those with in-house experience will be prioritised Experience recruiting across corporate functions and key business teams in a high growth environment, ideally have seen scale from 200 to 1000+ in a similar tech, B2B/B2C, SaaS/ecommerce/payments startup Experience hiring senior IC candidates, middle/upper management and c-suites Able to demonstrate solid examples of tangible results in both volume and strategic hiring Not afraid to work with senior management and a culturally diverse workforce Skilled with admin and scheduling - we’re as hands on as can be here You are passionate about process, and hyper organized - you’re the most organized person you know and don’t let things slip through the cracks You ultimately care most about finding the right fit for Xendit and the candidate - and are willing to be responsive to candidate enquiries and last minute rescheduling out of office hours You’re comfortable with ambiguity and chill even in the weirdest circumstances You thrive on autonomy and have proven you can push towards a goal by yourself You’re often told you pay attention to details You often to say yes to spontaneous or crazy ideas expecting a fun time

Our client is an international research and consulting firm, part of a fast-growing billion dollar industry Working with corporate organisations, private equity firms, banks and legal firms, they provide their clients with access to critical industry research and information required to make major business decisions such as acquisitions and investments A global business, our client has been established for close to 25 years and has 10 offices across the US, Europe and APAC region. Salaries vary from SGD 3000 - 7500 per month (basic), depending on seniority plus a 3 month bonus. We are open to graduate applicants with relevant degrees e.g. economics, finance etc TO APPLY DIRECTLY, PLEASE SEND YOUR CV TO *****@IGNITETALENTASIA.COM Current positions Due to continued growth in Asia, our client is now hiring for several key positions in their Singapore office, With a focus on strategic client management, project scoping and high-level coordination of research-engagements, the Junior Associate will build relationships with clients, understanding their business requirements and identifying the best solution that will allow them to make smarter business decisions. You'll manage a number of accounts which could include corporates across a range of industries, or private equity and other financial institutions. This will require someone who is able to pick up and understand a client’s business quickly, working across diverse industries from cryptocurrency to pharmaceuticals to technology. You’ll distil key challenges and translate client requirements into tangible solutions. Most of your time will be spent working on inbound enquiries from clients. You'll own client relationships but other teams will largely lead execution on strategy and research projects, so you'll work in partnership with them across project execution. You'll manage multiple projects on a daily basis which might involve interviews, surveys and in-depth engagements with a project timeframe of 1 day to 3 months. The Associate will (in partnership with sales teams) be responsible for growing the revenues delivered from their book of business comprising of several clients, so it is important that the have a commercial mindset and strong communication skills. Requirements We are interested to hear from candidates with a professional background in market research or management consulting, financial services, account management / business development etc. We are also open to fresh graduates with relevant academic experience or internships Bachelor’s degree preferred Great communication skills and fluency in English (ideally Mandarin in addition given the need to speak to clients in China) Exposure to project management with experience of delivering high quality work to a deadline Prior experience with direct client communication and some level of ownership of client relationships (preferred) Strategic thinker – ability to quickly interpret client requirements and translate into specific deliverables Ability to multi-task and prioritise activities effectively, while ensuring a high level of accuracy and attention to detail Ability to identify best match/solution of requests/questions and to handle increasing responsibility over time Potential for growth In addition to a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, you can expect a generous bonus of up to 3 months of salary. There is huge potential for upward and outward growth as part of this professional, highly regarded and fast-growing global business. About Ignite We are Asia's leading recruitment agency focused on data & analytics, market research, business intelligence and insights. We are always hiring for a diverse range of roles in the region and looking for people with a background in Qualitative research, Quantitative research, ResTech, Digital Insights, Marketing Analytics, Social Listening, Cultural Insights & Semiotics, Operations, Business Development, Innovation, Trends, Growth Consulting, Choice Modeling, Data Analysis, Project Management, Research Operations, Fieldwork, Account Management and Client Success. We'd love to hear from you! Business Function The technology department enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group Technology department, they manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Job Purpose As a Business System Analyst, you will be responsible for developing technical solutions to business problems. This usually begins with defining, analysing and documenting the requirements. Managing requirements at the project level can help fulfil business needs. Solutions often include a software-systems development component, but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and policy development. The candidate should value simplicity and impact, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and have the ability and desire to learn. Candidate also require having greater flexibility, greater discipline, and the willingness to work in an evolutionary manner. Key Accountabilities Work with business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business process, establishing project scope and goals. Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure requirements are clear and delivered successfully. Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure solution design is optimized for efficiency. Facilitate conflict resolution and be able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective. Develop, execute and manage the project plan, and take corrective actions when project deviates from plan. Coordinate with business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases. Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues. Initiate User Requests (Request for Service) for enhancements on behalf of the business. Responsibilities Bridge the communication between the development team and business stakeholders, by providing the details explaining the requirements to the team. To identify stakeholder needs, negotiate priorities between repeating stakeholder factions, and then collaborate with developers to ensure that the requirements are implemented effectively. Provide clarity in business requirement to allow developers to provision estimates, and serve to represent stakeholders, to provide business priorities. Act as an SME in the respective domain with sufficient knowledge to interact, solicit requirements, and advise business users on the best solutions Help develop compelling and innovative solutions while complying with existing standards, guidelines, and processes Perform end-to-end technical impact analysis and lead the requirement gathering with business users. Propose alternate solutions to meet or improve the desired objectives based on best practices and industry solutions and influence the desired outcomes Verify that the user requirements are achievable and support business users during UAT and post-implementation phases Effectively translate user stories/ pain points into technical specification details and collaborate with various development teams to produce high quality deliverables Review test cases and help resolve requirement/implementation issues during testing phase Perform Proof of concept before project inception General Requirements Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent business and technical written and verbal communication skills to document and specify requirements to solve business problems Ability to facilitate and elicit requirements. Significant and solid understanding of software development life cycle. At least 5-7 years + of development or system design working experience Proven experience of having solved complex analytical and technical problems Strong analytical skills and proven ability to simplify and clearly communicate complex analytical outcomes, linkages, and messages Strong business and technology knowledge on Wealth product offering and processes Strong team player and interpersonal skills Self-starter and motivated Technical Requirements Ability to create software prototypes on an ad hoc basis Advanced process modelling by creating flow diagrams and models UML diagramming Data analysis with standard query language, PL/SQL, Python and advanced Excel macros Knowledge on Tableau or Power BI is a bonus Experience with both relational and NoSql database Ability to perform technical impact analysis independently and resourceful in finding information required Understand conduct interface analysis, the understanding of technology infrastructure and how it interconnects, including sharing data to achieve a business goal. Proficient with various tools for design, collaboration and issue management as well as agile software and development Prior experience and technical knowledge on Avaloq is preferred Additional Skills 1. Avaloq parameterization skillset 2. PL/SQL 3. Full stack 4. Relational DB 5. No-SQL DB

Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer/ ML Data Engineer At VIDA we’re building the future of digital identity. As a Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer you’ll have a key hand in building out the data infrastructure to analyze, train, and serve machine learning models in production to verify and validate our user’s identities. As an early member of the team, you’ll have the ability to shape and build the next-generation data platform that will enable countless users to participate in the online digital ecosystem. Responsibilities: Design and build fast, flexible, and reliable services for ML model training and serving Design and build a data platform that enables data scientists and analysts to query and slice data for machine learning and surfacing product metrics Build and own scalable machine learning microservices that will power our real-time identity verification stack Collaborate with data scientist, product, engineering, and infra ops teams to deploy easy to use infrastructure for production ML models Work with product and operation teams to ensure that they have the relevant data and metrics to enable better decisions Requirements: A strong engineering background and experience with data infrastructure and/or distributed systems Experience with or strong interest in developing and deploying ML models in production Expert in Python, C++, Scala, or Java Experience in writing and debugging ETL jobs using a distributed data framework (such as Spark, Kafka, or Flink) Experience with pipeline/task orchestration tools (such as Luigi, Airflow, Kubeflow) Experience with Kubernetes is a plus Take pride in taking ownership and driving projects to have a business impact Thrive in a fast-moving collaborative environment ABOUT VIDA What are we trying to solve? We have 7.5 billion people on Earth, of which over 1 billion cannot securely prove their identity right now. Every year, 140 million babies are born, of which 40 million go unregistered. Simply put, these people are deprived of social benefits, such as education and health, their civil rights to vote and travel; and are excluded from the economy because they cannot sign up for bank accounts, loans, welfare programs, etc. We believe this is unacceptable and needs to change. At VIDA, We are creating a frictionless digital identity system. One that fulfills the needs and expectations of our times, and is available anywhere, for everyone. Why are we solving this problem? The United Nations (UN) and World Bank ID4D initiatives aim to provide everyone on the planet with a legal identity by 2030. This deadline is just 9 years away, we are expecting a digital identity to be a legal human right by then and we at VIDA want to be pioneers in leading this change. Who are we? We are a highly driven bunch of people to solve this problem for our own reasons. Whether it is to solve for misleading doctors, or because we didn’t get access to fair ration due to corruption - Our collective goal aligns. Other things that we care about: Our mission is to enable trust, so what we do is pretty serious stuff – we work hard and we have audacious goals. We balance it through humor and making sure we have fun at work. We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We are a startup so at times we will do things that are outside our scope. We do it to learn but we also do it because it takes a village. We believe feedback is a gift and should be given freely, constructively, and in a respectful manner. We are accountable to many stakeholders, but first and foremost, we are accountable to our mission and each other

About Restaurant Brands International: Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with more than $35 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 28,000 restaurants in more than 100 countries. RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands – TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES® and FIREHOUSE SUBS®. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities. The Restaurant Brands International (RBI) Global Development team is recruiting a Manager to be based in Singapore and work with RBI’s APAC Global Development team tasked with finding new master franchise partners for our brands in Asia. The individual in this role is expected to assist the team on all aspects of business development, including sourcing new partners, financial modelling, preparation of investment and brand presentations as well as working with RBI’s and investor’s legal counsel to negotiate and finalise Master Franchise agreements. RBI Culture: At RBI, we are driven by our vision to build the most loved restaurant brands in the world. With more than 27,000 Burger King, Tim Hortons and Popeyes restaurants in more than 110 countries, we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better in serving the diverse guests who come into our restaurants each and every day. At RBI, we believe: - Dream Big: Life is too short for small dreams - Ownership: You value things more when you own them - Meritocracy: Your growth is based entirely on what you do and how you do it - Diversity: A wide range of voices and perspectives make us stronger - Creativity & Innovation: Find ways to do things differently to make them better - Authenticity: Be a hard-working, good person We are looking for talented people who share our vision and values to join our Global Development Team. Together, we can make a difference when committed individuals bring together their resources and their resolve. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion; we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Qualifications & Skills: • Undergraduate degree • At least 5 years of M&A, Accounting, or Business Development experience at a leading Accounting Firm, Law Firm, or Investment Bank • Outstanding judgment and ability to identify, distil and manage complex issues quickly and effectively • Excellent excel and PowerPoint skills • Fluency in written and spoken English; Mandarin Chinese, Japanese and/or other Asian languages will be considered an asset • Ability to explain financial and investment concepts, build consensus and think creatively • Strong collaborative skills, including the ability to coordinate with RBI business leaders and executives, business development colleagues, finance, accounting, legal and tax partners and other advisors • A positive attitude and ability to work well within teams and the skills to work across business functions and cultures with teams located in multiple time zones, as well as the ability to act independently in a fast-paced environment. • Highly organized and Results-oriented Key Responsibilities: • Financial modelling skills (business plans, investor returns etc.) • PowerPoint skills to create, format and present complex concepts in a logical and well-designed presentation • Ability to source for new potential investors across geographies in APAC through existing networks and new channels • Ability to interact with potential investors and explain our brands and Master Franchise agreements • Ability to work with multiple business units across RBI to collect and synthesise information • Perform other general business duties and functions as may be assigned or required by business needs Leadership Capabilities: • Ability to influence key decision makers and break down roadblocks to complex projects. • Highly resilient, possessing the tenacity to challenge the status quo. • Ability to contribute actively to shaping the strategy of the business, both, short term and long term. • Experience in managing diverse stakeholders in complex structures across multiple levels and cultures.

About Us The people at Industrial Scientific are committed to ending death on the job by year 2050, and we need more help. Our leaders understand the critical elements of breakthrough performance: bringing out the best in people; creating a climate of trust, openness, and high performance; fostering candor; and treating people fairly and with dignity. At Industrial Scientific and Fortive we believe in hiring the best talent and developing our talent throughout the organizations. Being part of the Fortive Group opens a world of opportunities for you. Fortive Corporation Overview: At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow and make an impact. And we believe in giving you the opportunity, accountability and visibility to do just that. At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of great people working together to innovate and solve problems no one could solve alone. We build enduring partnerships with our customers and take on their challenges and opportunities as our own. At Fortive, we believe in growth. Ability to work effectively in a global virtual environment, with strong service orientation, teamwork collaboration skills What you bring with you Graduate with a Bachelor’s degree (preferred) More than 3 years of experience in HR Ability to be independent in a highly agile environment Proficient English communication with excellent interpersonal skills; fluent Mandarin is preferred Equal Opportunities Industrial Scientific/Fortive is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. About us Portofino is a blockchain based digital asset startup located in the Crypto Valley. Our headquarters are in Zug, Switzerland with offices in London, Singapore and New York. Backed by the biggest VCs in the world, we aim to build the best digital asset “platform” in order to become the world’s leading crypto-currency market maker. Our first mission is to build & deploy a high frequency trading system in digital asset markets. Being an early stage, scaling startup and are able to provide you with a large scope of projects in a competitive environment. Do you want to join our growing team in Singapore? We are looking for 1 junior C++ performance developer to join us at the earliest possible. Summary of the role As a performance or quantitative developer, you form the backbone of the business and are responsible for building our trading system as well as connecting to new exchanges. As an experienced C++ developer you are passionate about building scalable & performant technology. You are an ideal candidate if you are: Interested in solving low-latency systems problems and optimising performance-critical code Passionate about technology, interested in both low level details of how computer hardware operates and high-level design of large systems Have a “start up” mentality, are able to iterate quickly and write production quality code rapidly Your responsibilities Responsibilities will span the entirety of the trading system, and will cover multiple products & assets within the crypto-currency trading universe (e.g. cash, futures) Projects may include connecting to new exchanges, upgrading major trading system components, designing a completely new application from scratch In this role, you will have the opportunity to deploy your coding skills to build a large-scale trading system (from scratch!) and understand crypto-currency trading Your profile Higher university degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering with excellent grades Exposure or interest in capital markets, in crypto and blockchain environments is highly preferred Required technical competencies (must have) Excellent coding skills in C++ (C++11 onwards); initial experience in back end engineering / python programming. Ideally an ongoing or completed internship in software development Experience with writing high performance code & benchmarking Advanced skills with object oriented design, data structures and algorithms Experience with GDB & Valgrind Familiar with all phases of SDLC (unit testing, automatic build and release, peer-review, Jenkins, Jira, GNU Make / Cmake) Very good troubleshooting abilities with strong debugging and problem solving skills Understanding of network and hardware architecture Initial experience with thread pinning, CPU isolation, kernel bypass and shared memory Preferred technical competencies Experience in development of distributed systems and cloud services Intermediate to good knowledge of Database applications (SQL, KDB) Experience with running code in containerized environments is a plus, especially Docker and Kubernetes Experience with AWS (or other cloud software/infra) (nice to have) Experience with intel TBB, CAF of disruptor Experience with userspace network stack Experience with multiplexed event loops like boost asio, libuv Experience with custom memory allocation, memory pooling, handling of statically allocated buffers and buffer sets, using buffer sequences and scatter-gather io Experience with replacement classes for standard library classes Experience with NUMA, cache optimising code, hardware inference Experience in stopping template bloat Your personality You are a team player with good interpersonal and communication skills. You can work in a very focussed manner when required and pay extreme attention to details. You are a quick learner, have a flexible mentality and if required, are not afraid of stepping out of your comfort zone. You are passionate about technology, are a person who takes initiative, likes to challenge yourself and is willing to go the extra mile to achieve individual as well as team goals. You can work in a team as well as by yourself and can work under pressure to meet deadlines. You speak fluent English and enjoy working in an international environment. Our business language is English and in this role, you will regularly interact with our international offices. Our offer We can offer you excellent career opportunities with complete project responsibility right from the beginning You will be part of an international team and will have the opportunity to learn from as well as work together with industry experts We offer a flat hierarchy where every employee has equal chance to present their ideas and be part of a scaling business at a very exciting stage of the company We work hard and celebrate every success. We celebrate often You grow as we grow Interested? Then apply directly or contact us at **********@portofino.tech We look forward to your application!

JOB DESCRIPTION: Here's what your week might look like - Not everything has to be tested. You will identify when research is required and when best practices are the way to go. And you will help us communicate that to our stakeholders. - You will do the groundwork: qualitative and quantitative research. We've done some interesting stuff: diary study (we got people to log all their payments and write about each), Ethnography (observe how small merchants are coping with digital payments) and others. In short, we love to experiment and hope you will join in. - Once you've done the research, you'll create sharp and concise reports full of actionable findings. Your reports will be things of beauty that will inspire your colleagues to truly start seeing through the eyes of our customers. - UX is a pretty established discipline here at Bank, but we can always use help to evangelize the importance of good UX Research. Here are the experience and skills we'd love you to have - You have 2 to 3 years of relevant experience. - You've had hands-on involvement with the end-to-end research process. - You have a working knowledge of qualitative and quantitative data analyses, usability testing, and surveys. - You can filter out noise to uncover actionable insights. In our experience, people who are organized, methodical and analytical are very good at this. - You are an eloquent public speaker and an accomplished report-writer. - You are an empathic human being with interest in psychology, anthropology, human-computer interaction, cognitive science and business. Bonus points - You have experience in the fintech industry. - You've been a designer yourself (or have some design experience). We find that it really helps when working with designers. You will be working in the Banking Group UX Design team and the Research & Insights team. You will report to a research lead, and work very closely with people from Research & Insights. You will support research for a key Consumer Banking initiative.

Job_Descriptions: Sales Executive/Product Specialist (ENT NEURO DIVISION) This is a full-time permanent position. JOB PURPOSE The Sales Executive/Product Specialist is primarily responsible for securing product sales in Singapore, servicing and engaging the customers. The job holder also provides in-service training to users of products purchased by the customers and attend to clinical cases in the operating theatres. CRITICAL WORK FUNCTIONS & KEY TASKS 1. Business Development and Sales (a) Continually service and engage existing customers to (i) support them, (ii) understand their evolving needs, (iii) secure additional sales and (iv) develop them as advocates for the Company or products. (b) Network and source for prospects and interest them to try using the Company’s products and take follow up actions with the aim to secure sales. (e) Monitor and analyse the sales performance of products and take follow up actions. (f) Profile the customers to better understand their needs and potential and develop a plan to grow the accounts. (g) Develop and maintain Reference Centres (h) Scan the operating environment, keep up with developments in the medical equipment space and competitors’ activities to identify business opportunities. 2. Services and Support to Customers (a) Provide post-sales support and services to customers including getting their surgical and nursing personnel to be trained on the features and usage of the equipment. (b) Train the users of the product personally when necessary (c) Attend to cases in the operating theatre personally for new clients 3, Others (a) Perform other assignments and projects as assigned by the management QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED (a) Degree, preferably in science, bio-medical science, nursing or engineering (b) Minimum 2 years of experience in marketing/selling

Company Overview INFICON is a growing, global, leading provider of innovative technologies that enhances productivity and quality in sophisticated industrial processes. The products provided by INFICON are world-class instruments for gas analysis, measurement, and control and are vital to manufacturers and end-users in the complex fabrication of semiconductors and thin film coatings for optics, flat panel displays, solar cells, and industrial vacuum coating applications. INFICON is headquartered in Switzerland and has world-class manufacturing facilities in Europe, the United States and China with subsidiaries located throughout the world. For more detailed information about INFICON, please visit our website at www.inficon.com. Broad Function The Service team is the primary interface between the client and INFICON and must reflect our unwavering commitment to customer satisfaction and support. You are responsible for the serviceability of the INFICON Instrument and maintaining an excellent client relationship by resolving/escalating any problems/concerns encountered. You will work with a broad range of client stakeholders as well as the various Business Units Product Managers and Support Team. For pre sales assisted you would help in demonstration and technical support. For Post sales you would help to install and commission units and conduct customer trainings. You will help to troubleshoot and repair the assigned INFICON instruments to achieve customer satisfaction. For this position, our ideal candidate would have a strong analytical background, and able to read engineering drawings. Prior experience in quality control and service role is also a plus. Willingness to learn our industry, work with fellow team members and with clients, and adapt to changes is required. Company Overview INFICON is a growing, global, leading provider of innovative technologies that enhances productivity and quality in sophisticated industrial processes. The products provided by INFICON are world-class instruments for gas analysis, measurement, and control and are vital to manufacturers and end-users in the complex fabrication of semiconductors and thin film coatings for optics, flat panel displays, solar cells, and industrial vacuum coating applications. INFICON is headquartered in Switzerland and has world-class manufacturing facilities in Europe, the United States and China with subsidiaries located throughout the world. For more detailed information about INFICON, please visit our website at www.inficon.com. Broad Function Intelligent Manufacturing Systems (IMS) is a division of INFICON that makes industry-leading scheduling, visualization, and process control software to optimize semiconductor and related-industry manufacturing operations. Sensor Technology and Control (STC) is a product line consisting of various sensors utilize for process monitoring for the semiconductor industry. The IMS Application Engineer is the primary interface between the client and IMS and must reflect our unwavering commitment to customer satisfaction. You are responsible for maintaining an excellent client relationship and for resolving/escalating any problems/concerns encountered. You will work with a broad range of client stakeholders, the other members of the IMS consulting team, and the IMS software development team to successfully and efficiently deploy our applications to help our clients achieve their objectives. You will train end users, support client change management needs, test client requested application changes, and meet project budget and timeline. For this position, our ideal candidate would have a strong analytical background, experience in semiconductor manufacturing, familiarity with industrial engineering concepts, and basic knowledge of SQL. Prior experience managing software deployment projects and process control is also a plus. Willingness to learn our industry, work with fellow team members and with clients, and adapt to changes is required. Main Duties & Responsibilities · Assist in the entire project life cycle by helping to define clear deliverables, determine what expertise is required, produce estimates of program/project requirements based on changing client needs, and adhere to the schedule to meet project goals. · Work closely with other members of the IMS consulting team and the INFICON global and regional sales teams. · Provide written and oral feedback to Account Manager and IMS Management on weekly activities, customer requests, needs and requirements. · Work closely with the IMS software development team including providing feedback on applications, communicating new feature requests, performing QA for new versions, and managing deployments. · Assist with the deployment and support of IMS software and Sensors. · Provide technical assistance to customers related to IMS products and services. · Provide written and oral feedback to the customers on applications work including process-troubleshooting, development, and advanced analysis techniques. · Provide onsite training for INFICON products, primarily focused on IMS software systems and services. · Be able to support regional sales by providing technical demonstrations and presenting product offerings in technical presentations. · Other duties assigned by superior and/or management of the Company. Requirement · Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline (Engineering, Physics, Chemistry or related sciences) or diploma in relevant engineering discipline with work experience. · Excellent verbal and written communication skills for both external and internal customer relationships. · Ability to adapt to various field situations and to foster strong relationships with internal and external customers. · Requires strong analytical skills and critical thinking to solve complex problems · Requires strong organizational and computer skills. · Solid understanding of semiconductor manufacturing is desirable or Understanding of semiconductor process control systems (FDC and APC), factory automation, and statistical process control is a plus. · Ability to travel internationally (10-50%)

Job Purpose The Bank is building a new platform to enable users perform Balance Substantiation via the General Ledger Account Ownership (GLAO) module. The module will enable core functionalities such as Balance substantiation/approval with workflows / processes with an intention to completely automate the end-to-end process, across all locations. This job position will need to be the single point of contact to bring together the requirements, interpret, analyse, document, work with the technology team on the build, test and finally support release of the GLAO module for the bank. Key Accountabilities: 1. Single point of contact for all functional activities related to building of new General Ledger Account Ownership module. 2. Document requirements using Agile User Story formats and work with technology team to groom the user requirements 3. Work with technology / end users to come up with a thought through solution. 4. On completion of the build, test the solution and release it for production usage. 5. Document functionality and work through processes for sustainably managing the platform in BAU. Job Responsibilities: 1. Be key focal point to front all User+Technology related queries in building the new GLAO module. 2. Track all new change requests that are assigned to GLAO module’s Backlog and bring it to prioritization forum. 3. Manage book of work with the Middle Office Technology teams – both in terms of bringing items for discussion during bi-monthly prioritization forum and tracking it for delivery and closure. 4. Participate in Build and test phase for the new GLAO module build + handle regressing testing in BAU, representing Group Finance systems. 5. Act as an interface between Technology and Business teams in terms of delivery timelines, development statuses, user clarifications, clear bottlenecks, obtain user signoffs. 6. Keep a close tab of all enhancements/minor projects that are concurrently running in terms of timelines and statues. 7. Timely escalation of any potential bottleneck / delay to Reference Data SME / Hub Lead. Core Competencies: 1. Team player – being able to work with multiple stakeholders across business / technology. 2. Ability to grasp information/knowledge in quick time and pick up skills on the job. 3. Able to balance day to day deliverables amidst multiple moving projects. 4. Flexibility and resilience to manage changing priorities - good in multi-tasking. 5. Ability to multi-task with a “Can do” attitude. 6. Good communication skills to manage various stakeholders. Technical Competencies: • Hands-on experience in GLAO / Substantiation module (or) any other similar tool will be an added advantage but not mandatory. • Able to interpret and understand the system processes in a logical manner would be an added advantage.

We are looking for 2 experienced quantitative traders to join us at the earliest possible. Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Translational Cancer Consortium (STCC) aims to strengthen the overall impact of cancer research and translation in Singapore by bringing together key basic, clinical and translational teams on joint platforms to actively establish and implement collaborative cancer programmes. The consortium will be under the Ministry of Health Holdings (MOHH) Pte Ltd and anchored by the cancer research programmes and commercialization platforms of STCC’s research partners (NCCS, NCIS, NUS, CSI and A*STAR). Responsibilities : Integrate and analyze highly dimensional spatial profiling data (digital spatial profiling, spatial transcriptomics, multiplex immunohistochemistry, single-cell transcriptomics, etc.) to derive novel biological insights in tissue regions or specific cell types at single-cell or sub-cellular resolution Correlate findings with clinical data to develop prediction models for patient risk stratification, disease prognosis, treatment recommendation, etc. Retrieve and organize various publicly available clinical datasets for analyses and interpretation Engage internal/external stakeholders of diverse backgrounds (clinicians, pathologists, lab scientists, bioinformaticians) to understand key scientific questions and transform complex problems into actionable insights Support the design and execution of spatial multiplex assays to ensure robust statistically valid conclusions can be drawn Analyze and report data in a comprehensive and repeatable way Communicate data and analysis results to a variety of audiences Optimize and implement multiparametric/multi-platform data integration and analytics for better understanding of data, data generation process and quality control Stay on top of state-of-the-art assays platforms and analytical techniques, and advocate best practices Provide support to other STCC platforms, specifically in the area of data science and analytics Job Requirements Preferably PhD Degree and/or postdoctoral fellowship in Cancer Biology, with experience in high-dimensional data analytics Proficiency in concepts of molecular and cell biology, cancer biology and tumour immunology Proficient in spatial data analytics, including data cleaning, data normalization, data transformation, data visualization and statistical analysis Experience with one or more spatial multiplex technologies, including but not limited to digital spatial profiling, spatial transcriptomics and multiplex immunohistochemistry Proficiency in using R or python programming languages for data analytics Proficiency in handling clinical data, including survival analyses, multivariate regression analyses and other basic biomedical statistical methods Proven track record in contributing advanced data analytics to scientific publication Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills Resourceful and able to work independently and in a team with minimal supervision Good analytical and effective problem solving skills Self-starter, proactive and results oriented * This is a 3 years renewable contract position

Deep Learning / AI Scientist At VIDA we’re building the future of digital identity. As a Deep Learning/AI scientist, you’ll have the exciting opportunity to build out core pieces of technology to verify and validate people’s identities. You’ll be building out deep learning models in facial recognition, optical character recognition (OCR), and researching methods to protect these services against malicious actors. As an early member of the machine learning team, you’ll be expected to roll up your sleeves and own the model pipeline from end to end. Responsibilities: Design, train and deploy computer vision models to facilitate the eKYC process: facial recognition, OCR, document verification, etc Design, train and deploy models to protect users from fraud and other malicious actors Owl the full lifecycle of deploying models: from data labeling, working with engineers to design scalable APIs, to monitoring and A/B testing new model versions Build the next generation of our model training and scoring infrastructure, in close collaboration with infrastructure teams Collaborate with business, product, operations, and engineering teams to deliver impact for our customers Work independently or in a team to solve complex problem statements Requirements: An advanced degree in a quantitative field, or many years of experience working on similar problems in the industry Deep understanding of modern computer vision techniques, deep learning, and machine learning Experience developing and deploying machine learning models in production Proficient in Python, C++, Scala, or Java Familiarity with modern deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet Experience with Airflow, Spark, SQL Experience in on-device inference for machine learning models is a plus Take pride in taking ownership and driving projects to have a business impact Thrive in a fast-moving collaborative environment ABOUT VIDA What are we trying to solve? We have 7.5 billion people on Earth, of which over 1 billion cannot securely prove their identity right now. Every year, 140 million babies are born, of which 40 million go unregistered. Simply put, these people are deprived of social benefits, such as education and health, their civil rights to vote and travel; and are excluded from the economy because they cannot sign up for bank accounts, loans, welfare programs, etc. We believe this is unacceptable and needs to change. At VIDA, We are creating a frictionless digital identity system. One that fulfills the needs and expectations of our times, and is available anywhere, for everyone. Why are we solving this problem? The United Nations (UN) and World Bank ID4D initiatives aim to provide everyone on the planet with a legal identity by 2030. This deadline is just 9 years away, we are expecting a digital identity to be a legal human right by then and we at VIDA want to be pioneers in leading this change. Who are we? We are a highly driven bunch of people to solve this problem for our own reasons. Whether it is to solve for misleading doctors, or because we didn’t get access to fair ration due to corruption - Our collective goal aligns. Other things that we care about: Our mission is to enable trust, so what we do is pretty serious stuff – we work hard and we have audacious goals. We balance it through humor and making sure we have fun at work. We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We are a startup so at times we will do things that are outside our scope. We do it to learn but we also do it because it takes a village. We believe feedback is a gift and should be given freely, constructively, and in a respectful manner. We are accountable to many stakeholders, but first and foremost, we are accountable to our mission and each other

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in Strategy/Operations. Experience in project management and execution. Preferred qualifications: Experience working with large datasets (e.g., Sheets, SQL database queries/analysis). Experience using business intelligence and dashboards (e.g., Connect Sales, Data Studio). Knowledge of digital ads and Google’s business. Ability to succeed and exercise judgment in a fast-moving and ambiguous environment, and work with people from a broad range of backgrounds/experiences. Excellent communicator with great presentation skills, with the ability to write well and convey complex issues clearly. Excellent collaborator with ideas, determination, and a passion for the Internet. About the job The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. As part of the South East Asia (SEA) Operational Excellence Hub, you will support strategic project across Malaysia and South Asia while also seeking to embed operational excellence in a scalable manner. In this role, you will work with cross-functional leads and with partners across the sales organization (e.g., Account Managers, Country Managers) to address key strategic and operational challenges. You will provide business critical insights and recommendations, bringing stakeholders together while ensuring excellence in project management to ensure we stay focused delivering efficient impact. You will also own cross-functional, go-to-market projects, focused on ensuring that we define and deliver operational best practice across the SEA sub-region. The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. Resposibilities Respond to problem statements raised by the local leadership team via hypothesis generation, problem-solving, and insight generation across competitive/landscape/performance assessments. Work closely with Country Leadership to identify key quarterly strategic and operational priorities. Define key success metrics and execution plans, review organizational efficiencies, and develop organizational design proposals to achieve service model excellence. Work within the Operational Center of Excellence team to identify scalable ways to improve operational excellence and drive these within their markets of focus.

Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of experience with analytics, marketing technology, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting, or financial analysis in a customer-facing role. Preferred qualifications: 8 years of experience in digital media, ad tech, marketing analytics, and/or consulting. Experience collaborating with third-party tech/measurement vendors. Knowledge of third-party outcomes measurement solutions (e.g., MMM, Sales Lift) and vendor ecosystem (e.g., Nielsen, GFK, Kantar, Analytic Partners, etc.). Ability to take ownership over projects by setting/achieving milestones, synthesizing input from stakeholders, creating output appropriate to the audience(s), and driving awareness/adoption of final deliverable. About the job Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. You'll help clients who rely on MMMs to deliver excellent ROI for Google media. In this role, you will utilize your understanding of industry practices, digital media trends, analytical abilities, and your persuasive influencing skills to influence advertisers to take the necessary actions to determine brand, media customer value, and channel impact. Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. Develop communications for internal and external partners including VP levels. Build monthly/quarterly cadence for tracking, updating, and communicating to key stakeholders and markets. Drive consultations (i.e. from defining the hypothesis, to test design, to store match and up to results sharing). Uncover measurement-related challenges, and develop bespoke solutions across stakeholders to drive business growth.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience with data analysis, spreadsheets, and financial modeling. Experience in the technology industry, strategy consulting, corporate finance, or similar industry in an analytical role. Preferred qualifications: Advanced proficiency in spreadsheets; familiarity with SQL and analytical experience working with large volumes of data. Driven self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and can self-direct work in an unstructured environment. Sound business judgment, analytical skills and problem solving skills. Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. Ability to craft and deliver a message with credibility to influence senior leadership. About the job Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. Working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to take on big picture challenges. With your analytics and financial acuity, you'll liaise between the Finance team with the functional areas it supports. You resolve issues related to forecasting, planning, resource prioritization and business profitability, and you help translate analyses into easy-to-understand presentations. The Partnerships Business Finance team is a strategic business partner to the Global Partnerships (GP) organization. GP builds meaningful relationships that power extraordinary user experiences, advance partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. They help build, grow, and distribute Google products through partnerships across various Google product areas. They also help publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, playing a major role in helping partners navigate change that delivers economic and reputational value. The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business. Resposibilities Engage in deep-dive analyses to provide the Global Partnership management with clear insights and recommendations into the business, market trends, risks and opportunities utilising data-driven techniques and tools (R, SQL, Tableau, etc). Support critical financial processes such as business forecasting and goal setting. Provide finance guidance on commercial and economic values of strategic deals to ensure they are driving value for the business Support the operation of commercial deals from a finance perspective, including deal modeling, performance tracking, deal governance and strategy.

Job_Title: Market Responsibility Specialist, Trust and Safety, YouTube (Vietnamese)
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience in tech policy, intelligence, or regulations/government relations. Experience with the local politics, media landscape, culture, and context of the Vietnamese market. Experience in cross-functional project management across executive stakeholders. Ability to speak, read, and write in English and Vietnamese fluently to identify abuse trends. Preferred qualifications: Experience working with Product Management and Engineers to drive progress on key programs. Experience with SQL and spreadsheet softwares. Ability to build effective relationships with cross-functional partners across geographies. Ability to use data to drive strategy and business action. Excellent analytical skills. Excellent organizational and project management skills with excellent attention to detail. About the job Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. As a Market Responsibility Specialist, you will ensure that we are constantly growing our understanding of regional and local trends/risks on YouTube. You will monitor trends and intelligence sources, help to launch new product features with market and language insight, and ensure the enforcement of guidelines are informed by market knowledge. In this role, you'll help implement and enforce policies across content videos, define/implement operational plans, and liaise and partner with stakeholders (e.g., Product Management, Engineering, Vendor Operations, Analytics, Public Policy, PR, Partnerships, and Legal). This role may review graphic, controversial, and sometimes offensive video content during team escalations in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines. At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. Resposibilities Work with cross-functional teams and leverage market insight to identify key abuse trends in the Vietnamese market, monitor emerging sensitive events, and highlight risks to the YouTube ecosystem and Trust and Safety. Speak Vietnamese and English fluently in order to effectively identify and propose policy improvements based on market nuances, and support language detection, automation, language quality improvements, and local product launches. Support identification and vetting of external partners. Triage threats, prepare risk assessments, and action plans based on market knowledge, including regional events and escalations, and act as the main point of contact. Drive and support the launch of news related product features in the region.

Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience with measurement platforms, analytics, and attribution modeling Preferred qualifications: Experience with Implementation/Configuration of Measurement, Web Analytics or Attribution Strategy including: Data-Driven Attribution/Non-Last Click Attribution, Cross-Device Measurement, Conversion Tracking, Geo-Experiments, Incrementality/Lift, Online-to-Offline measurement, Offline Data Import Experience with leading third-party measurement, site analytics (Adobe, Omniture), CRM, and data systems. Experience in dealing with and influencing senior advertiser / agency decision makers Experience in presenting insights and results to senior audiences Knowledge of Google measurement capabilities across ad and media platforms including Google Ads, Search Ads 360, Google Analytics. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. You will be an expert at using data to help our partners make better decisions, which in turn will drive the app business. Your knowledge of monetization and the full marketing funnel combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities will position you at the heart of App measurement strategy. You will provide project management skills, analytical expertise and business judgment to support strategic and tactical activities. App Specialists care deeply about the unlocking the full potential of the app ecosystem and seek to do so by helping app developers cultivate an install base of active users that can drive business outcomes for the developers. Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. Resposibilities Work to provide deep measurement support by leading conversations with product, marketing, and data science teams, operating as an expert on effectiveness and lift testing for App marketing efforts. Become a trusted advisor for clients in navigating privacy changes and developing scalable templates, models, processes to broaden impact. Develop lifetime value model by major vertical that includes looking at user engagement and retention, monetization and virality by vertical to better measure LTV. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, marketing, sales, global leads, regional client side instrumentation) to roll out LTV based measurement approach, both internally and externally. Partner with Sales/Sales operations to develop and test tools, dashboards, templates and frameworks to streamline and scale client analyses.

Job_Title: Full Stack Software/Cloud Engineer - Asset Management - Fixed Income - Associate
Job_Descriptions: What We Do At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible.  Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas.  Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients.  Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action.  Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists’ groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions.  Want to push the limit of digital possibilities?  Start here. Goldman Sachs Asset Management Division: As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals.  To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and deep across asset classes, geographies and solutions. Goldman Sachs Asset Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AMD delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment. AMD Data Engineering builds on top of cutting edge in-house and cloud platforms complimented with a strong focus on leveraging open source solutions. How You Will Fulfill Your Potential on the Fixed Income Engineering team: As a Fixed Income Engineer, you will be joining a core team of engineers dedicated to building solutions to massively scale our Portfolio Management capabilities leveraging Cloud-based solutions to augment the existing on-premises.  In your role, you will work closely with our global business partners, and peer Engineers embedded with our business partners to identify and tackle high-impact challenges that aim to scale the operating capacity for the next 10x to 100x growth in business transactions.  The role offers a variety of challenges and welcomes depth and/or breadth across the technical domain. We are seeking accomplished Software Engineer, Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer or all of the above to accompany us on this exciting journey.  We seek passionate and curious individuals that thrives on learning, solving, and collaborating toward robust and scalable solution. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related Engineering Field 5+ years of experience with building and delivering production grade on one or more general purpose programming languages, but not limited to: Java, Scala, or Python Knowledge in one or more SQL dialects Experience with all stages of the development lifecycle: inception, analysis, design, review, testing, and deployment Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including experience working directly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Experience that will help you thrive: Experience engineering or solution architecting with Cloud-based services: AWS or GCP Experience with high-throughput data pipelines and big data engines: Spark, Flink, Kafka, Iceberg Experience with Cloud infrastructure provisioning: IaC via Terraform Experience with Containerization and Orchestrating runtimes Experience with integrating Observability: Prometheus, OpenTelemetry Experience with full-stack prototyping Experience with API curation and design Experience with CICD management Experience with Linux Understand networking concepts ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers. We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. JOB DESCRIPTION At Arcadis we focus on attracting, retaining and developing people who share our passion and commitment to improve quality of life. In return we offer you the opportunity to transform your world and the world around you, that could be through client work, upskilling yourself, championing equality and inclusion or getting involved in charity work, to name just a few. Our people value different perspectives, they care about the sustainability of our planet and dare to shape the future. One of our core values is ‘people first’, and supported by our Lovinklaan foundation, we invest in you for the long term, to ensure you reach your full potential. You’ll have the opportunity to own your career and work on industry-defining projects, finding solutions to real challenges that make a difference to people’s lives. You’re encouraged to have a growth mindset and are given the space to develop personally and professionally, building a flexible career that works for you. Role description: Function independently as the project assistant and project quantity surveyor and be able to work with Directors and Associate Directors in delivering professional pre and post QS services with minimal supervision. Responsible for delivering positive outcomes for our clients, demonstrating leadership and coaching to other Quantity Surveyors and Assistant Quantity Surveyors, and innovation of service and knowledge. Role accountabilities: Provide support to the Associate Director / Director in cost management of projects. Work collaboratively with other Quantity Surveyors to manage related issues on the multi-disciplinary projects and liaise with stakeholders on requirements. Representing the company in a professional and diligent manner, meeting, negotiating and corresponding with clients forming a strong working relationship in true partnership. Take a leading role in setting team objectives and priorities, working as a proactive team player. Effective communication ensuring all information is available for the successful completion of projects, to liaise with other managers to ensure efficient financial control resulting in projects being cost effective. Liaise with other managers to ensure consistency of service delivery and to identify opportunities for developing both the quality and profitability of the service. Understand Client’s requirements and undertake feasibility studies. Preparation of pre-contract cost estimates, cost plans, budgetary study and project cash-flow for variety of developments using Cost X; Cubicost or similar. Measurement (taking off quantities) for all structural and architectural elements. Preparation of tender and contract documentation Tendering process and tender evaluation Provide cost information and studies on value engineering analysis. Post-contract administration and management – contract documentation, valuation of progress payment, variation assessment, and cost control and financial reports (including cashflow) Finalization of project final accounts Attendance at project meetings. Contributes to team and project performance by collaboration and effective communication. Adds to team effort by accomplishing other duties as assigned. Digital and Building Information Modelling (BIM) You shall work alongside with the Senior BIM and Digital Manager in implementing, executing, training, managing and delivery of the digital and BIM solutions to the Cost and Commercial Management business. The individual will be of a practitioner capacity and is responsible for advising technical aspects of BIM production for projects. You will also support Asia digital transformation journey by establishing and supporting adoption of BIM processes, BIM Execution Plan (objectives, requirements and conditions) and a delivery strategy in conjunction with a client and delivery teams for pre and post contract.  Delivery strategies will also involve liaising with and supporting the growth of BIM teams within the Arcadis’ Global Excellence Centre (GEC) and become the ‘connection’ between the Cost and Commercial Management business’ needs and GEC capability. The individual will play an important role in transforming how we deliver digital services to our clients by continuously exploring new possibilities with BIM and matching them with client needs to deliver commercial potential. You will act as a digital ambassador enabling our people’s transformation of the digital strategy in Asia. Qualifications & Experience: Recognised Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Building, Quantity Surveying or equivalent from recognized universities. Minimum of 8 years of QS relevant working experience. Good technical knowledge – Measurement, cost estimating, construction technology, contracts and law Understand and familiar with professional practice and contract administration processes. Able to work as a team player and multi-task on few on-going projects/ assignments. Ability to communicate clearly in both spoken and written English is essential. Ability to work with digital software (e.g.: CostX; CubiCost) will be essential. Work experience gained from consultancy firm preferred. Candidate to have clear and analytical approach to problem solving, and strong decision-making abilities. Ability to communicate and work with Employers Why Become an Arcadian? Our work with clients has a direct impact on people’s lives and on the planet. We make moving, living and belonging in cities safer, more resilient and more sustainable. By partnering with our clients as responsible custodians of our earth's resources, we can create a sustainable planet. We continue to think of new ways to make positive impacts and create better experiences for people; data driven and digital solutions have become part of the Arcadis DNA. Working together with clients and using techniques like design thinking, we can get to the heart of our clients’ most pressing challenges and work together to solve them. As a global business, we have committed to support five of the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals to ensure that our projects contribute to a better and more sustainable future for all. But it’s not just the work that we do on client projects that benefits communities and our planet. As a global business, we are committed to making a positive impact to society by supporting local communities where we operate. To help protect our planet, we monitor and measure non-financial information to inform business decisions and reduce our own environmental impact as part of our commitment to be net zero carbon as a global company by 2030. Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day, which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. At Arcadis, you will have the opportunity to build the career that is right for you. Because each Arcadian has their own motivations, their own career goals. And, as a ‘people ﬁrst’ business, it is why we will take the time to listen, to understand what you want from your time here, and provide the support you need to achieve your ambitions. Transform Your World
