Location: Bedok Mall, 311, New Upper Changi Road, Simpang Bedok, Bedok, Singapore, 467360, East Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Our COFFEESARANG is a cafe where we provide a customer with a fresh drinks(espresso coffee, tea), a handmade foods(waffle, sandwich, brunch), and authentic desserts(Korean Bingsu, cake). Therefore, we would like to hire a new staff with the following preferred conditions - Customer Service Mind with Positive Attitude & Smile - Professional Career as a Barista - Team-Working with Other Different Background We will contact you after reviewing it. Job_Title: Data Engineer - Department of Educational Development
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on What we are looking for Competencies have long been used as a framework to help focus employees' behaviour on things that matter most and help us drive success. We are looking for candidates with the following competencies:

What the role is As Singapore's first polytechnic, Singapore Polytechnic (SP) prides ourselves in providing the best learning experience for our students in pre-employment and continuing adult education. The mission of SP is as a polytechnic for all ages, we prepare our learners to be life ready, work ready, and world ready for the transformation of Singapore. Our vision is to be a caring community of inspired learners committed to serving with mastery. Manager (Admin) – Department of Student Development The appointee is expected to manage the administration, finance/budgeting/asset management & procurement as well the IT systems and processes of the department.   This includes key department admin and business process design, review, implementation, audit and redesign. He/She will also manage a team of admin support staff, both internal and outsourced for the running of the department’s admin and operations support duties.    The appointee will be required to provide leadership and to work with other sections in the department and with other departments in SP too. The appointee will also be required to manage student clubs. He/she should enjoy working with youths and with people of all levels and be able to engage them in his/her area of work. What you will be working on Main Responsibilities:- Develop comprehensive and quality admin processes, policies, digitalization tools aligned with the SP’s overall policies and systems Review and put in place necessary audit systems and respective Management Reporting To oversee the overall general office admin, shared dept admin and finance/procurement systems for the department. Develop tools and templates for staff to manage their administrative duties and introduce appropriate digitalization tools to improve work/admin processes in the dept. Coordinate Department CRM Responses and Feedback Surveys Mentor and guide staff under domain as Reporting Officer Part of the department’s management team in decision making Manage and Mentor CCA clubs and leading overseas student trips What we are looking for Requirements:- Should have 4 -8 years of relevant experience in the area of administration and systems/process design. Should possess a passion and understanding of finance, procurement and general administration processes and related IT systems. Have strong problem solving and analytical skills; technologically-savvy with a strong aptitude towards implementing digitalisation tools to improve or streamline admin processes. Self-motivated, creative and resourceful with good communication skills both written and verbal Experience or exposure in managing systems, projects and/or people or vendors as well as basic contract/vendor management. Successful candidate will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance. Closing date: 10 March 2022 If you are shortlisted for the position(s), you should hear from us within 30 days of the closing date of the advertisement

Research Fellow, PMS (2-year Contract) Job Description MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (i) Clinical implementation projects (CIPs) Be instrumental in project management for the CIPs to meet the timeline and deliverables Work closely with the lab team to validate the performance of a laboratory designed assay on the microarray platform Coordinate the testing workflow from specimen receipt to reporting Oversee routine laboratory operation of equipment pertaining to the CIPs, including charting of work performed, inventory and ordering of reagents and test kits, and preventive maintenance of equipment Contribute to project documentation, including writing work plans, work instructions (WIs) and technical report Perform experiments pertaining to the CIPs and analyze the data with minimal supervision from the lab director Work with the team to develop the polygenic risk score pipeline Develop innovative applications for microarray based diagnostics Support the lab’s research efforts and expand the use of microarray for population genomics Prepare research presentations and manuscripts (ii) Routine lab operation and quality Follow processes that meet the College of American Pathologists (CAP) requirements Ensure all documentation is in compliance with CAP requirements. Responsible for equipment maintenance and WIsDevelop tools and best practices for clinical testing and implementation Ensure all changes to the scope, test kits, methodology of the assays are documented and approved by the lab director Keep accurate records of work undertaken (iii) Education Constant upgrading of knowledge by reading and discussing scientific literature regarding new diagnostic tests and investigation strategies in journal clubs, seminars and presentations to diverse audiences Responsible for students, both undergraduate and postgraduate, when they are attached to the laboratory Train and supervise laboratory personnel or attachment students in experimental techniques Support educational program, workshop or seminar of the service JOB REQUIREMENTS EDUCATION PhD in molecular biology, genetics or related disciplines TRAINING/SKILLS REQUIREMENT Strong technical background in genomics. Good understanding of pharmacogenetics and polygenic risk is a plus Must have hands on experience with standard molecular biology techniques including DNA and RNA extraction, PCR, sequencing and genotyping Prior experience with microarray is highly desirable At least 2 years of experience in management of projects Analyze data independently and contribute to team science Excellent organizational and data management skills Good writing and presentation skills Able to work in a team environment A publication track record EXPERIENCE Preferably with 2 years prior research lab experience with a strong background in genomics and molecular biology. Research Assistant (CRIO) (1 year contract - renewable) Job Description Job Summary Assisting principal investigators and research teams in the conduct / implementation of research studies Planning, organising and coordinating the workflow of the research studies Screening potential participants and determine eligibility to be enrolled to the studies Recruiting eligible participants and ensuring their compliance to the study requirement Administering surveys, questionnaires and medical case notes review Venepuncture, handling and processing of blood samples / human specimens Maintaining up-to-date investigator files, timely CRF completion and documentations in EMR of assigned trial/study Coordination study meetings Requirements Diploma in Nursing, Biomedical Sciences or a related field Preferably 2 years’ experience in supporting research studies. Job_Title: Senior / Executive, Inpatient Operations (3 Year Contract)
Job_Descriptions: Senior / Executive, Inpatient Operations (3 Year Contract) Job Description Broad Function Assist the Inpatient Operations team to drive the three main work streams, namely, Non-Clinical Workflows Operations Readiness and Ramp-Up Pre-Operations (Yishun Campus) Support Clinical Departments within the Division of Medicine with development of services and processes to ensure safe and efficient care for the patients Key Responsibilities and Duties Specific Non-Clinical Workflows Analyse, review and map or develop routine inpatient ward non-clinical workflows in the following areas: Patient On-boarding and communications Inflight Services Flows, Routes and schedule for Housekeeping, escort, meals and portering Hospital-Wide: Real Time Location System (RTLS), (Patient Information Board (PIB) and other IT-related projects Operations Readiness and Ramp-Up Support the development of inpatient wards extraction and migration plans from WHC’s pre-operations host-sites by working with multiple clinical and non-clinical stakeholders Engage with respective Ministry of Health Departments to ensure that the extraction and migration plans are within Ministry guidelines Ensure the smooth execution of the extraction and migration plans and that patient care and staff migration is seamless and hassle-free Review design and architectural documents to ensure compliance with inpatient ward service requirements Review facilities, equipment and instrument requirements to ensure the compliance to inpatient wards clinical and non-clinical needs Support the planning of medical and non-medical equipment requirements and procurement, and in line with the inpatient services and campus opening plan Coordinate and review the fitting out, training, defect, handover, rectifications, installations and supplying of procured equipment and supplies for inpatient wards Review, develop and conduct Table-Top Exercises and rehearsals in line with workflows developed for inpatient wards to prepare for Campus Opening Support the preparation activities required for the licensing of the Campus in accordance to our Campus opening plan, which includes the set up relevant IT and financial systems Pre-Operations (Yishun Campus) Support the planning, development and operations of WHC pre-operations inpatient wards in the Yishun Campus which include the following: manpower ramp-up, clinical services plan, staff deployment strategy and facilities management Provide ground operations support (incident and fault management, statistics monitoring, leadership walkabouts, staff training and recruitment) Coordinate and lead continuous improvement projects to lower ALOS, patient case management and process improvement projects Coordinate with Yishun Campus on pilots and to ensure that new policies and practices are communicated and aligned with WHC pre-operations wards before implementation General Where directed by Reporting Officer, and/or Director, Medicine & Community /Inpatient Ops, to support in other WHC-related projects and tasks Job Requirements University Degree in any discipline from a recognised institution Some years of related experience in a similar capacity, preferably in an operations or service background for Executive At least 3-4 years of related experience in a similar capacity, preferably in an operations or service background for Senior Executive Healthcare experience is a bonus Ability to plan, organize, supervise and execute Strong project management skills Analytical and innovative thinker Good interpersonal and communication skills Manage internal and external relationships, especially with clinicians Ability to work independently and also in a team Please be informed that only applications submitted through NHG Career Webpage (corp.nhg.com.sg/Careers), WHC Career Webpage (whc.sg/joinus), JobStreet Singapore (jobstreet.com.sg), Singapore Medical Association (sma.org.sg), Singapore Nurses Association (sna.org.sg), MyCareersFuture.sg, LinkedIn and WHC appointed recruitment agencies will be considered. If you are accessing this job posting from another recruitment channel, please visit the official channels mentioned above. What the role is Senior Research Executive / Research Executive, School of Applied Science (Temporary Contract up to Feb 23) What you will be working on Primarily responsible in carrying out the CRISPR-based diagnostic projects. Proactively offer support to colleagues, project teams and stakeholders within own area of expertise. Maintains safe and healthy work environment by following standards and procedures; complying with regulations. Helps in efficient functioning of the lab by placing and receiving supplies and maintaining supply inventory. Keeps equipment operating by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; maintaining supplies; performing preventive maintenance; calling for repairs. Documents results by maintaining logs; charting data; preparing reports. Keeps project leader informed by pointing out unusual results. Protects organization's value by keeping research information confidential. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; learning new skills, reading technical bulletins and engaging with researchers. What we are looking for Qualification in Molecular & Cell Biology, Biochemistry, Genomics or related fields. Prior experience in molecular cloning, CRISPR-based diagnostics will be highly advantageous Experience working in a team with good interpersonal skills. Exhibits meticulous attention to detail. Is committed to producing accurate and high-quality work. Practiced documentation skills. Aware of basic safety issues. Follows safety procedures and maintains a safe work environment.

Hiring_Company: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Job_Title: Lead Engineer / Engineer, Ops Systems Engineering, Ops Systems Sustainment Centr
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You play an important role in assessing and enhancing the Operations & Support (O&S) management, reliability and availability of the various MHA Ops Systems (including but not limited to software, hardware, systems, services). What you will be working on Evaluate budget papers submitted by project teams to ensure that the maintenance and operation support requirements of the new projects are adequately catered for and aligned with the existing O&S processes, including allocating sufficient resources. Evaluate and strengthen the O&S processes and standards so as to enhance the maintenance of Ops Systems across MHA throughout their life cycle, including obsolescence management, system refresh, and mid-life upgrade. Work with project teams in flagship programmes to incorporate O&S requirements and specifications as well as reviewing the maintenance design and strategy. Manage and monitor existing system/service contracts to support MHA ops, including overseeing their day-to-day issues. Manage vendors to ensure contractual requirements and Service Level Agreement (SLA) are met, and to take appropriate corrective actions as required. Put up contract variation when required, including submitting budget papers and technical specifications for approval. Manage and implement ICT security measures as required under government policies. Manage any other tasks as assigned by the supervisor. What we are looking for Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical and Electronics Engineering or equivalent. Three (3) years or more of relevant work experience, preferably with O&S experience in ICT ops systems. Experience in maintenance planning, analysis & support; fault & resolution management; and system performance management. Ability to analyse O&S data for improving or introducing predictive mode to maintain ops systems will have an added advantage. Experience in using Technologies for O&S to enhance ops systems, such as data analytics, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, will have an added advantage. Experience in project management, contract establishment & management, vendor management and incident management will have an added advantage. Possess a good grasp of IT industry best practices and processes, while keeping abreast of advances in Technology and best practices. Possess excellent planning and analytical skills. Self-motivated, pro-active, dedicated, competent as well as possess the ability to work independently and drive to successfully complete tasks. Possess good communications (both oral and written), presentation, reasoning ability and problem-solving skills. Ability to work in teams and independently. All new appointees will be appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance. We wish to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

What the role is The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) champions the development and transformation of the built environment sector, in order to improve Singapore’s living environment. BCA oversees areas such as safety, quality, inclusiveness, sustainability and productivity, all of which, together with our stakeholders and partners, help to achieve our mission to transform the Built Environment sector and shape a liveable and smart built environment for Singapore. BCA seeks to transform the Built Environment Sector and shape a liveable and smart Built Environment for Singapore through info-communications technology, digital solutions and related engineering. We are looking for resourceful, energetic and self-motivated individuals who are inspired to play an active role to make a difference to Singapore’s built environment. What you will be working on As a Digital Business Analyst, you will support the Chief Information Officer at BCA and collaborate with fellow project managers, solution architects and technical services consultants to deliver leading-edge digital solutions. You are a pro-active, self-motivated and resourceful team member with good tech/digital knowledge and possess strong influencing and people handling skills. You are also adept at balancing multiple projects concurrently while constantly looking for new ways to apply digital technologies to meet identified Agency and citizen/business needs. Responsibilities: You will be involved in a range of tasks including the following: Partner with the business teams to elicit business needs and develop the appropriate business case Assess current state, analyse stated requirements of stakeholders and accurately defines business need within specified scope Work with project teams to develop requirements such as user stories, functional/technical specifications and acceptance criteria Evaluate and recommend suitable technology, including sourcing and evaluating alternatives, and recommending solution that best fits stakeholders' needs. Manage conflicts, issues and changes to ensure stakeholders and project team remain in agreement on solution scope Plan and project manage the implementation and maintenance of various systems/initiatives Work with stakeholders to ensure smooth deployment and adoption and operation Analyse impact of requested changes and propose improvements to continuously address changing business needs, and work with support team to understand and address technical problems (Operations & Maintenance phase) What we are looking for Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related subject area with minimum 1 year of relevant experience. Prior working experience in IT project management, business analysis, application solutioning design and testing Participated in at least one full software or product development cycle, preferably using Agile Methodology Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem-solving skills Good communication skills with the ability to pitch ideas and influence A driven and motivated personality with an inquisitive mind Ability to learn and apply Preferred Skills: Business Analysis certification, e.g. Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Past Project management or Business Analysis experience Knowledge or hands-on project experience in Azure and AWS, APIs & Microservices environment. Successful candidates will be offered temp employment under recruitment agencies. Interested applicants, please apply online.

Location: Tanglin Mall, 163, Tanglin Road, Orchard, Singapore, 247933, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Responsible for the preparation of high-quality Shawarma goods in a timely, efficient, sanitary and consistent manner in line with quality standards. Prepared to work in a fast-paced, high pressure work environment, while maintaining the organizational ability to identify and act on job duties quickly and effectively. Prepared to work as a team member in a dynamic workplace, follow all hygiene and safety procedures. Responsible for the daily preparation of Shawarma goods in the Shawarma section. Follow standard recipes, portion controls, and presentation specifications as set by the Head Chef. Ensure that the correct quantities are prepared to meet daily needs. Ensure that the station is always clean while practicing good safety, sanitation and organizational skills. Restock all items as needed throughout the shift. Frequently check on fridge and freezer temperature and record them using the appropriate forms. Follow proper reporting procedures for accidents and incidents to ensure follow-up and prevention. Maintain grooming, self-hygiene and shape appearance at all time by respecting company grooming standards. Perform additional responsibilities as requested by Head chef at any time. Attend and participate in daily briefings, debriefings and other meetings as scheduled and bring suggestions for improvement. Maintain a favorable working relationship with all other company employees to foster and promote a cooperative and harmonious working climate, which will be conducive to maximum employee morale, productivity and efficiency, and effectiveness. Salary will commensurate with experience. Minimum 2 years of related experience. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

What the role is The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) champions the development of a future ready built environment for Singapore. Besides regulating building safety, we lead and transform the built environment sector in delivering a safe, high quality, sustainable and friendly built environment. We are looking for resourceful, energetic and self-motivated individuals who are inspired to play an active role to make a difference to Singapore’s built environment. What you will be working on Coordinate, update and handle Covid-19 related duties (eg. monitor Ag+ cases, vaccination status of staff etc). Submit Enforcement Officer (EO) appointments to MOH for approval and update the overall listing of EOs and inform MOH to revoke appointments for officers who left. Assist in data verification/data cleansing work related to HR data in HR system Assist in monitoring of document submissions from staff Other administrative duties as required (eg. filing of documents, arrange for meetings etc). Job_Title: Assistant Manager/Manager, Policy and Planning (Strategic Planning)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of the team involved in the development and implementation of the next 5-year plan for the arts sector, as well as driving organisation excellence in NAC. The work ranges from policy development and review, corporate planning, performance tracking, to secretariat duties. You will play a vital role in facilitating engagement with internal and external stakeholders, to achieve alignment and smooth implementation of NAC’s work. What you will be working on 1. Identify emerging trends, assess implications on the arts landscape in Singapore, and recommend policies and programme interventions. 2. Collaborate with stakeholders to align strategic priorities, formulate strategic plans, and track performance indicators and targets as part of the planning and budget cycle. 3. Monitor and report progress of strategic plans, organisational performance and risk indicators. This includes collation and analysis of data, and preparation of reports for management, NAC Board and the parent-Ministry. 4. Organise corporate planning events such as staff conference, management and Board retreats, and conceptualise meaningful messages for stakeholder engagement. 5. Perform secretariat duties for key meetings and support senior management on strategic decisions. What we are looking for Inquisitive mind, strong analytical and critical thinking skills Strong relationship management and organisational planning skills Adept at working with numbers and good knowledge of Excel. Familiarity with data analysis and visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau) would be an advantage Excellent written and verbal communication skills, to deliver presentations and facilitate meetings. Team player who is proactive, independent and reliable to drive projects forward Preferably at least 2 years of relevant work experience in public policy, business, economics, social sciences or related fields Applicants who require work passes need not apply.

Hiring_Company: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Job_Title: Engineer, Workplace Safety, Health and Security, Home Team Sustainment Centre
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As an Engineer in the Workplace Safety, Health and Security (WSHS), Home Team Sustainment Centre, the job holder is expected to formulate, drive and sustain the WSHS Management programme across HTX to develop and nurture a strong safe work culture that emphasises individual ownership and promotes a spirit of looking out for one another’s well-being. What you will be working on Job Scope / Key Deliverables The principal accountabilities of the job holder are to: Establish the WSHS management systems in line with HTX WSHS Policy, Goal and Strategy. Ensures that the WSHS management system, programme and processes comply with WSH legal requirement, Code of Practices and safety standards. Lead initiatives, such as risk management programme to institute a robust and sustainable safe work culture in HTX. Plan and develop Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for standardisation and implementation of WSH objectives across HTX. Engage stakeholders to identify work-related hazards, security hazards and mental well-being hazards for risk assessment, and formulate appropriate control measures to reduce risk to as low as reasonably practical. Conduct regular workplace inspection, audit and stakeholder feedback to measure and monitor WSHS performance. Provide staff support to HTX WSHS Steering Committee and Management forums on all WSHS matters. Provide regular reports to Senior Management on WSHS performance and recommendations for improvement. What we are looking for Job Requirements Candidates should possess: Tertiary qualifications in Science, Engineering, Environment and Occupation Health and Safety, Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) or equivalent. Professional certification in in WSQ Advanced Certificate in WSH or Specialist Diploma in WSH. Minimally 3 years of work experience in WSH in marine or construction or manufacturing or service industry as Workplace Safety and Health Officer / Coordinator. Being able to work independently, being analytical with excellent interpersonal, communication and basic IT (powerpoint, excel) skills are required. Possess good writing skill. Having digital infographics skill to create digital communication materials would be advantages. Able to build consensus across different functions and stakeholders and give advice on WSH legal and other requirement as well as identification, analysis, control, and monitoring of work-related hazards. Continuous learning mindset to maintain currency on WSH legislations, code of practice, and industrial best practices. Team-player mindset is necessary, as the jobholder may be required to assist in other duties if needed. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. All applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

Job_Title: Lecturer (Marine Engineering & Naval Architecture) – Singapore Maritime Academy
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The job of an academic is challenging and meaningful. Not only will he/she have both the knowledge and working experience, he/she must also possess a passion for working with youths, nurturing them and moulding their characters. There will be opportunities to develop the curriculum, introduce new courses as well as be involved in consultancy and other applied research projects. Administrative work related to teaching and School/Institutional strategic initiatives will be an important part of the job too. Successful candidates will be expected to be resourceful and innovative with initiative and good communication skills. The candidate is expected to develop and teach the Diploma in Marine Engineering and Certificate of Competency courses in the following areas: Marine Power Plant (Marine Diesel Engines, Marine Boilers, Steam Propulsion) Marine Engineering Ancillary systems Marine Electrical Technology and Electronics Marine Instrumentation and Control systems Naval Architecture Basic Occupational Safety & Security Training Engine Room Simulator Training IMO Conventions and Legislations What you will be working on Conduct lessons and review teaching materials for both Pre-employment Training (PET) and Continuing Education and Training (CET) courses Ensure that new/existing teaching curriculum modules are aligned to the Standards of Training, Certification and Watch-keeping (STCW) convention and to the practices of the maritime industry Collaborate with industry to enhance students’ learning through activities such as industry field trips, student-industry projects, internship program and overseas programme. Serve as an advisory role to ensure equipment and training facilities are updated and operationally-ready for practical training sessions to ensure an authentic learning experience. Exercise mentorship and pastoral care to students. Participate in Internal and External Quality Maritime Education and Training (QMET) audits. Support polytechnic and school events especially in the area of education counselling guidance and outreach What we are looking for Holder of Marine Engineering Officer Class 1 or Class 2 Certificate of Competency issued by MPA or relevant authorities. At least 4 years of working experience within the maritime industry. Passionate about education and possess strong interest in teaching and mentoring students. Team player with the ability to work independently. Possess good communication skills, both written and verbal. Applicants with no teaching experience may apply Successful candidate will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance. Closing Date: 10 March 2022 If you are shortlisted for the position(s), you should hear from us within 30 days of the closing date of the advertisement.

Job_Title: Senior Manager / Assistant Vice President, Innovation Economy (Strategy Group)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is About EDB The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB), a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry, is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business, innovation and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development, and work with international businesses, both foreign and local, by providing information, connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth, with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore. For more information on EDB, please visit www.edb.gov.sg. What you will be working on Job Responsibilities Identify and engage companies and their stakeholders (e.g. customers, suppliers, research institutions) to gather insights on new growth opportunities Analyse and synthesise findings to map industry value chains, challenges and needs Develop compelling value propositions and co-create solutions to strengthen Singapore as an innovation economy, in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. industry groups in EDB, other government agencies and industry partners) Contribute to EDB’s innovation process through learning on the job and refinement of the internal innovation toolkit Review and refine strategies to catalyse innovation activities in Singapore, such as: o Understand local and international R&D and innovation policies, as well as its wider impact on Singapore and our economic competitiveness o Analyse the research and innovation intensity of sectors which EDB oversees, to define EDB’s approach in encouraging industry research and innovation activities While you will be responsible for leading key workstreams in Innovation Economy division, you will also have opportunities to exercise peer leadership in inter-divisional and/or inter-agency working groups. What we are looking for Requirements At least 6-8 years of relevant working experience, with applications of design thinking principles or innovation methodologies/tools (e.g. Lean Start-Up) and/or working on corporate innovation, venture creation or business development; experience in policy-making will be an added advantage Passionate about playing a role in developing the future growth drivers for Singapore, with a strong interest in emerging trends, future industries and technologies Demonstrates a keen sense of business acumen with strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills Resourceful with a self-starter mindset; strong ability to develop and execute ideas and initiatives Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and spoken; is adept at engaging a range of internal and external stakeholders across seniority levels Strong team player in an agile environment; versatile and open to learn, explore and experiment Singaporean We review applications and interview on a rolling basis. Applicants can expect to receive an application outcome within 8 weeks of application date.

What the role is About EDB The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB), a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry, is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business, innovation, and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development, and work with international businesses, both foreign and local, by providing information, connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth, with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore. For more information on EDB, please visit www.edb.gov.sg What you will be working on Responsibilities This is primarily an individual contributor role. With guidance from the Vice President / Assistant Vice President / Senior Manager, you will contribute to the development and execution of strategies in the following areas: Carbon services and low-carbon technologies: You will conduct in-depth analyses of global trends, technologies and business models in environmental sustainability, with a focus on carbon management, to derive relevant insights and implications for Singapore, and recommend actions needed to anchor new environmental sustainability activities in Singapore. You will also work closely with both internal stakeholders as well as industry and government agency partners to develop and implement new initiatives to achieve EDB’s industry development goals for environmental sustainability. Energy & chemicals industry development: You will work closely with key companies and relevant external partners in government and industry to develop and implement initiatives related to the transformation of the energy & chemicals industry. Cleantech capability building programme management: You will work with internal stakeholders, government agency partners and the research ecosystem in Singapore to manage EDB’s existing capability building programmes for clean technologies, including the Energy Innovation Research Programme and Solar Competitive Research Programme. This will entail tracking and reviewing the progress of ongoing research projects and managing the related grants and incentive disbursements. What we are looking for Requirements The successful candidate should possess the following: Background preferably in Economics, Engineering, Chemistry, Operations Research and/or relevant interdisciplinary field At least 2 years of relevant work experience, preferably in the energy, chemicals and materials sectors or an area related to environmental sustainability; project/business development experience will be a bonus. Ability to pay good attention to detail and undertake programme management work independently Excellent analytical, problem solving, critical and lateral thinking skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and spoken Ability and experience in engaging and managing both internal and external stakeholders Ability to work on cross-functional teams and multiple workstreams to deliver outcomes effectively and efficiently Possess a self-motivated and positive attitude, excellent work ethic and is a team player We review applications and interview on a rolling basis. Applicants can expect to receive an application outcome within 8 weeks of application date.

Hiring_Company: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Job_Title: Engineer, Operations and Policy, Home Team Sustainment Centre
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As an Engineer in the Operations and Planning (OP), Home Team Sustainment Centre, the job holder is expected to formulate the policy and concept of operations for the integrated Home Team Sustainment Centre (HTSC) across four capability sustainment operations, namely Buildings, Platforms, Network and Security to generate the highest systems availability whilst minimising life cycle support costs. What you will be working on Job Scope / Key Deliverables The principal accountabilities of the job holder are to: Establish the operational policy, concept of operations and workflow of the integrated HTSC. Plan and develop standard operating procedure (SOP) for seamless coordination of routine operations and incident management across the four Capability Sustainment Operation Centres. Develop contingency plans to scale up operations of the integrated HTSC to meet ad hoc operational requirement of the Home Team Departments (HTDs), especially in the event of major disaster, heightened security, or pandemic. Engage HTDs to address any gaps in the HTSC operations and follow up to recommend improvements to the operational policies and procedures. Ensure that the HTSC SOP are reviewed for relevancy and currency. Communicate the SOPs to stakeholders in the Capability Sustainment Operation Centres. Support the transition of existing capability sustainment operations into an integrated HTSC operations centre. Job_Title: SVP/FVP/VP, Group M&A, Group International Management
Job_Descriptions: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. With presence in 18 countries outside Singapore, Group International Management (GIM) seeks to enable each and every of the Group’s international entities to deliver holistic banking solution to our target clients.  GIM serves as a “bridge” to bring countries and Head Office stakeholders together to ensure smooth business operations and bring meaningful value to the UOB franchise. Through its FDI Advisory team, GIM further offers a comprehensive one-stop platform that helps companies enter foreign markets, maneuver the complex regulatory landscape, and provides local business insights. GIM also supports the Group’s M&A activities, and the Strategic Investment Workgroup, that works with business units to manage the Group’s Fintech investments. The M&A team within the UOB Group/Group International Management plays a critical role in supporting the Group’s M&A and strategic investment ambitions. The team is responsible for the end-to-end project life cycle of M&A and strategic investment transactions working alongside business sponsors and advisers. Team members will be expected to keep abreast of industry market trends and dynamics, competitive intelligence, market positionings, regional regulations and policies to identify and evaluate M&A and strategic investment opportunities. Team members will work with investment banks and other financial advisers to originate opportunities. The team collaborates with internal business champions on their requirements and aligning its deliverables with objectives of Group Strategy. The team advises senior management and business sponsors on opportunities, and follows up with comprehensive evaluation, structuring, negotiating and brings such opportunities to completion. During evaluation phase, the team project manages internal due diligence teams and works with advisers, focusing on identifying synergies and risk assessment. Team members further work with business champions and the strategy team for clearing management and board governance processes. Post-signing, the team ensures smooth handover to the integration team. Team members will further track/monitor post-investment developments especially for strategic investments. Successful candidates can further expect to be assigned ad hoc corporate projects and/or business routines within Group International Management from time to time A good degree from a recognized university. Those with a postgraduate qualification such as MBA, CPA or CFA would have an advantage At least 8 years’ relevant experience either in investment banking or financial advisory and ideally with project management qualification and experience Additionally, private equity investing experience would be an advantage Experience covering financial institutions and financial technology would be useful especially those with a strong understanding of the ASEAN banking and fintech landscape Strong communication, writing and interpersonal skills Able to work independently and as part of a team; FVP/SVP appointees would be expected to manage teams Candidates with experience as IBD FIG Director/VP/Associate or those having related experience would be ideal UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Senior Specialist/Specialist will assist the Deputy Director in leading the project team to manage the development projects. He/she will provide the deep specialised skillsets in project management to develop organic capability within HTX. He/she will also address the downstream infrastructure management and contract management issues of development as well as demand aggregated contracts. What you will be working on Responsibilities The job-holder may be assigned to any of the three branches in the Building and Infrastructure (B&I) Division - Infrastructure Management, Project Development, Cost and Contract Management, and handle a mix of projects from each of the branches. Reporting to the Deputy Directors in the respective areas, he/she is expected to provide technical support and guidance to the Home Team Departments (HTDs): For Project development, he/she will work with users to do front-end planning, acquisition management, implementation of the project, and provide inputs for tender specifications for consultancy services prepared by the HTDs and tender specifications for B&I works prepared by the project consultants. He/she will manage and ensure projects are completed within the approved budget and schedule and also meet the quality and operational needs of the HTDs; For Cost and Contract Management, he/she will work with Facilities Management Managers (FMM) and HTDs to oversee the performance and calling of Demand Aggregated (DA)Term Contracts, including processing of Contract Variation Requests (CVR); he/she will work with HTDs to align them with the established guidelines and norms where applicable, as well as to ensure cost efficiency and prudence in utilisation of resources; he/she will work with the Quantity Surveyor to check and verify cost estimates, quotations, invoices and progress payment claims submitted; For Infrastructure Management work, he/she will work with users to oversee the performance of the FMM and Term contractors to ensure strict adherence to the contract specifications. He/she will be involved in the master planning for projects/programmes e.g. replacement of M&E systems/upgrading works and carry out quality audits, inspections and acceptance checks to ensure the services and works carried out by service providers meet the expected quality standards and specifications; he/she will also oversee and evaluate needs for repair, replacement and upgrading works What we are looking for Job requirements Tertiary Qualifications in Building or Quantity Surveying, Architecture, Mechanical & Electrical (M&E) or Civil & Structural (C&S) Engineering. Between 5-8 years of relevant experience in roles such as consultancy, contracting or specialist vendors in the building construction industry, with preference in consultancy roles. Sound knowledge in other construction related fields like cost and contract management, project and facilities management, with good analytical skills and interpersonal skills. Sound knowledge in Authorities’ Requirements, Regulations, Instruction Manual and Public Sector Standard Conditions of Contract (PSSCOC). Good in people management. Confident with good judgement to handle different situations. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. All applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Lead pre-project planning activities for technical delivery (eg. Technical delivery plan / approach, cost estimation, resource plan) Plan technical deliverables (including any system enhancements and upgrades) to meet project's requirements within allocated budget and schedule. Plan & collaborate across different application teams to manage technical dependencies of the solution Plan, monitor and manage risks/issues related to technical delivery Provide status update related to technical delivery Partner with System Analysts and Business Solution Specialist to collate, understand and finalize functional and technical requirements Partner with Architects and Development Leads to ensure solution design complies with enterprise design principles, security and control standards Partner with Development Managers in managing application teams to build the enhancements Partner with Test Manager to ensure completion of System Integration Testing (SIT), User Acceptance Testing (UAT), performance / load testing and application security testing with quality results Manage technical implementation plan across application teams - coordinate technical implementation activities across application teams to ensure non-event production cutover and adequate post implementation support Develop and maintain documentation adhering to organizational templates, policies, and standards. Escalate issues that impact project schedule on timely basis and propose workarounds/resolutions Experience in developing and delivering global / regional IT capabilities for a multi-national/regional company Experience in managing IT delivery teams Experience in actual systems development work, with prior coding, functional specifications and technical specifications and systems development and testing experience (in aggregate no less than 8 years) Compliance industry is a good-to-have Experience in communicating with technical stakeholders Experience in implementing large-scale, highly available applications or other large project implementation Proven result-oriented person with a focus on delivery Good understanding and experience in software development cycle Highly effective communicating with technical stakeholders, proficient communicating with non-technical stakeholders Good problem-solving, analytical, synthesis, system thinking and solutioning skills UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. Job_Title: Research Scientist (Artificial Intelligence) – Department of Technology, Innovat
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Centre of Excellence in Maritime Safety is a new R&D centre under the Department of Technology, Innovation & Enterprise (TIE). It aims to collaborate with the industry and research community to develop technological solutions and training systems to help reduce maritime incidents. The appointee will be part of the CEMS team in developing technologies to enhance simulator training and assessment, innovate in training pedagogy and develop digital technologies for the maritime industry. He/she will work with CEMS Principal Investigators (PIs) to conceptualise and prepare research proposals in the smart/safe maritime domain. The candidate be part of the AI team in CEMS and develop analytics capabilities in big data infrastructure and conduct data science studies for SP. What you will be working on Design research methodologies to develop AI algorithms and models. This includes designing and conducting experiments, as well as the implementation of the developed tools, systems and applications Build, organize, and maintain effective and efficient data infrastructure Build and develop data analytics capabilities in big data and conduct data science studies for SP Strengthen industry partners engagement to shape new initiatives in co-developing and adoption of new technologies Collaborate with Simulator Project Engineers to develop and deploy AI solutions to enhance simulator capabilities in training and assessment Oversee awarded industry projects and ensure key milestones and project deliverables are met Conceptualise research proposals and present research concepts and ideology to senior management What we are looking for Relevant qualifications in Computer Science or related disciplines Possess good knowledge in relevant research topics and skills Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, or C++ Excellent communications and interpersonal skills and possess the ability to influence and engage effectively with various stakeholders Ability to work in a fast paced environment Analytical and meticulous individual who is able to think strategically that align with SP and national agenda in maritime safety Past hands-on Data Scientist experience, and experience in building production grade AI models and products are added advantages At least 4 years of relevant working experience and good knowledge in the following areas: a) Big Data Architecture b) Natural Language Processing or Computer Vision c) Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Statistics Successful candidate will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance. Closing Date: 04 March 2022 If you are shortlisted for the position(s), you should hear from us within 30 days of the closing date of the advertisement.

Job_Title: Job Title GLOBAL IT SECURITY SPECIALIST 1
Job_Descriptions: Overview The Global IT Security Specialist 1 will be responsible for the remediation of threats and vulnerabilities in the company’s IT systems and software architecture and preparing for potential threats that could disrupt the company’s operations. They will advise management on policies and procedures related to the IT industry. The role requires in-depth expertise in specific hard skills such as networking and protocols.  They would be expected to be heavily involved and assist with tracking issues, coordinating training, updating documentation, and assisting the other IT teams in coordination of new features and vulnerability patching (if applicable). They will be a primary point of contact for Incident Detection and Response and will facilitate the remediation of security incidents on all endpoints.  They will need to be able to work with a global team coordinating tasks and projects related to information security and implement new technologies to further enhance the security of the company. Responsibilities Main technical knowledge expected Basic understanding of security systems including anti-virus applications, content filtering, firewalls, authentication systems and intrusion detection and notification systems. Basic knowledge of secure network architectures, encryption technologies and standards, application security, virtualization technologies and secure coding practices. Basic knowledge of identity and access management principles, networking routing techniques, social engineering, and Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) Basic experience developing, operating, and maintaining security systems Technical expertise responsibilities Act as point of contact for managed security detection and response service Acts as a technical resource for IT projects related to information security systems Execute and track the performance of security measures to protect information and network infrastructure and computer systems. Serves as a technical expert in information security by working to resolve assigned issues within security and coordinating with teams on solutions Creates documentation, including diagrams, for the IT Support Teams Performs regular System Monitoring for irregular behaviors and presents findings to Management Basic Troubleshooting and resolution of security infrastructure software and hardware Identifies and evaluates new technologies to enhance and support the company’s security Ensures system security best practices and Kemin IT policies are followed and in place Assists with periodic audits of global information security to ensure compliance to policies and standards Other responsibilities as IT technical expert Adheres to the Change Management Procedures as defined by WW IT Insight into how information security systems work together and integrate within the global infrastructure Assists IT management in guiding the organization’s information security technology in the global infrastructure systems Finds, obtains, and uses resources effectively to resolve problems General awareness of latest technology trends and technologies/methodologies Keeps up-to-date with upcoming information security changes and vulnerabilities and plans accordingly for the impact those changes would have to the overall global security Performs their responsibilities under general supervision and guidance from the WW IT Infrastructure and Security Team Manager Qualifications Candidate must be a customer oriented, team player, have strong communication skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment Research, understand, participate and contribute to the goals and mission of the IT Department and the company as a whole Perform all responsibilities of this position while continually presenting a positive and professional example for the rest of the team and the company Ability to train users at different skill levels Experience with help desk ticketing software Experience with incident troubleshooting and escalation Possess effective prioritization and project management skills #LI-AL

National Cancer Centre Singapore Research Fellow (Ref:DMOAT) Job Description Our understanding of the underlying biology of lung cancer has transformed with the identification of molecular subtypes of disease. However, the key drivers of tumour initiation and progression, which may underpin these subtypes remain to be completely elucidated. We are looking for a Post-doctoral Research Fellow with a strong background in bioinformatics to lead projects focused on the developmental cellular origins and pulmonary cell-lineage of lung cancer. He/she will be responsible for the following: - Integrated analyses of an array of cutting-edge genomic and transcriptomic datasets, such as single-cell RNA-Seq and spatial transcriptomics profiles of normal lung and lung cancer tissue from patient samples. - These datasets will be used to characterise cell lineage and their early development, and to study regulation of gene expression and pathways that drive malignant transformation at the cellular level. - Ultimately, this may identify therapeutic vulnerabilities in early malignant cell states – through an understanding of the evolutionary roadmap from differentiated pulmonary cell to oncogene driven malignant cell and adaptive responses to therapy. Auto req ID 9661BR Job Requirements A doctoral degree (Ph. D. or M.D.) in biological science or computational biology. Experience in one or more of the following areas: Genomics and RNA-Seq data analysis Differential gene expression profiling Genomic and/or transcriptomic single-cell expression analysis Spatial transcriptomic analysis. Statistical analysis (e.g., using R, Matlab). Programming (e.g., python). Wet lab skills will be an advantage, but not essential. Ability to complete tasks efficiently and independently. Strong work ethic and attention to detail. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in a collaborative setting. Job Category Research Job Function Research & Development, Research / Survey Services Employment Type Contract Full Time Location Singapore Education Level Doctorate/Ph.D.

You’ll be part coach, part diplomat, part entrepreneur - 100% committed to building and sustaining trust with users and your team. Stripe’s infrastructure and suite of APIs powers hundreds of thousands of businesses—from startups to Fortune 500s—in almost every country around the world. From developers and product managers to founders and CFOs, a broad audience interacts with Stripe’s products and uses them to start, run, and scale their companies. The Enterprise Support team directly supports our largest and fastest growing users, partnering with them to grow their business. We actively seek and capitalize on opportunities to meet and exceed their service expectations, working to impress the trendsetters and remove obstacles from their path. The team is there when users need us but also there proactively - before they even realize they need support. Stripe is looking for a leader to help build, expand and grow the Enterprise Support team. The manager will lead a high performing team motivated by improving the lives of Stripe’s user base. They cultivate the happiness of their teams while guiding them through feedback, mentoring, and advocacy within the organization. This means helping to set team goals, and using metrics to efficiently measure and guide team performance in pursuit of those goals. The Enterprise Support team is also responsible for managing large operational projects. You will: Guide the organization to design and deliver incredible user experiences. Ensure team members are happy, effective, and growing in their career and new work experiences. Set clear goals and directions, and provide regular feedback on team members’ performance. Maintain metrics and analysis of team performance, and provide regular reporting on team performance in the form of written analysis and performance reports. Transmit and foster our values, serving as a beacon of Stripe’s user-centric philosophy and culture of transparency, empathy, inclusion, and empowerment. Help build the organization through management projects such as recruiting, training, writing team policies, defining team processes, or other organizational improvements. Our ideal candidate will have many of the following: At least 4+ years of direct people management experience. Experience leading operational teams such as enterprise support teams (preferably in high-growth technology companies). Proficiency in SQL or any other data tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong operational background and a track-record of making data driven decisions. Skill and credibility doing the core work of a user facing team with a high bar for quality, and a willingness to lead by example. An ability to execute on and deliver complex operational projects involving multiple stakeholders.

Stripe is looking for a specialist to join a new function within our global Operations team focused on improving the integrity and security of our infrastructure. Businesses rely on Stripe to conduct business, and it’s critical that we experience minimal service disruptions and keep data secure. As a Security Operations Analyst, you’ll investigate anomalous activity, collaborate with Security Engineering to fine-tune threat detection models, and work to scale the team past its initial incubation stage. As a result, you’ll play a pivotal role in bolstering the integrity of Stripe’s infrastructure and elevating user trust in our products. You will: Act as our front line responder to security threats, investigating anomalies to uncover their root causes and coordinate further action with cross-functional stakeholders. Help establish team norms for communication and workflow with a mind for scale. Manage urgent triaging of security alerts with speed, collaboration, and accuracy, partnering with a global and broad set of stakeholders for fast resolution. Collaborate with engineering teams to align on and execute upon on-going improvements to tooling, manual and automated processes, and metrics. You may be a good fit if you: Enjoy investigating ambiguous problems with a keen eye for detail and a high bar for quality. Are proactive in identifying areas for process improvement and establishing best practices. Have foundational security knowledge and experience communicating with a range of stakeholders with sensitivity and discretion. Can problem solve and translate complicated technical issues into solutions, while keeping a security-first mindset. Are enthusiastic about developing and scaling a nascent function. Have operational awareness: a sense of the big picture in any organization they inhabit, how team members’ individual goals contribute to that, and how they can help team members navigate best within the big picture. Are familiar with MacOS and AWS environments Are proficient in or keen to learn SQL or equivalent query languages.

Job_Title: Partner Risk Operations Manager, Banking & Local Payments
Job_Descriptions: Stripe’s mission is to increase the GDP of the internet: we build economic infrastructure for internet businesses of every size in pursuit of this mission. The Partner Risk Operations team is responsible for managing the risk relationships spanning across global payment method, card, and banking partners. We are looking for a senior leader to design and manage the Partner Risk Ops Banking and Local Payments team, based out of Singapore! This role is responsible for advancing our operational risk strategy and agenda with our global banking and payment methods partners globally. Reporting to the Head of Partner Risk Operations, you will oversee a team of analysts based out of Dublin, the United States, and Singapore tasked with cultivating solid relationships with our risk partners, enabling future business growth for Stripe. The right person for this role should have a solid understanding of the financial ecosystem, obsess about metrics, and have a minimum of 7 years demonstrated experience leading operational teams in a highly regulated environment. You will: Define and execute the global vision, strategy, and objectives for the team; Manage all banking and local payments risk partnerships globally, ensuring compliance with regulatory, contractual, and service level agreements; Distill regulatory and financial partner requirements into operational processes and procedures, ensuring maximum efficiency and reducing operational costs; Collaborate with cross functional stakeholders on relationship and exam management; Lead and grow a high performing global operations team; Prepare and participate in regular business reviews and metrics meetings; Identify gaps in current systems, processes, policies and strategies, and propose data-backed enhancements and improvements to mitigate emerging risks, or optimize for efficiency and quality; We’re looking for someone who has: A minimum of 7 years of experience managing teams in a complex regulated environment; Confidence presenting to stakeholder audiences across all levels; Experience communicating with, influencing, guiding, and presenting to a variety of audiences; Strong analytical mindset; Familiarity with the global financial ecosystem; Demonstrated experience leading operational teams to excellence. Nice to haves: Experience managing global teams; Background in fintech, payments, or similar. You should include these in your application: Your resume and/or LinkedIn profile: A 2-3 paragraph summary of a requirement you operationalized from idea to execution.

Internal Audit Department Internal Audit Department (IAD) has been tasked with the mandate to foster a strong governance and control environment in GIC. IAD provides an independent assessment of GIC’s governance, risk management and internal control environment to key stakeholders including the Board of Directors and senior management. IAD acts as a trusted business partner working closely with the GIC group of companies and investment holding entities to bring about positive changes to the control environment and culture and thereby support senior management decision making. We are looking for a suitable candidate to join our Internal Audit Department as Associate, Business Auditor. Responsibilities Conduct audits with some level of supervision and guidance. Perform data analyses, walkthrough and testing using risk-based approach. Deliver on assigned tasks in a timely and efficient manner. Document clear and organized workpapers. Participate in department and corporate related initiatives. Proactively identify and recommend improvements to existing audit process and methodology. Requirements At least 3 years of working experience in business auditing, preferably in financial services industries. Bachelor’s degree in business, accountancy, finance or equivalent. Professional qualification such as CA, CIA, CFA or FRM is a plus. Good knowledge of audit strategies, tools and methodology, as well as risk & controls and corporate governance. Good knowledge or exposure to financial products and derivatives. Strong time management and project management skills. Strong communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills. Dynamic team player with high level of initiative, pro-activity and accountability. Demonstrated experience and proficiency in the use of data analytics and visualization tools (e.g. Python, SQL, Tableau) would be preferred.

About Us Dyson is a family-owned technology company with over 7,000 people globally - a third of whom are engineers and scientists.   We are growing fast.  Research, Design and Development is the heart of Dyson products. Our people are focused on enabling hardware and software to work together, developing intelligent machines which understand and react to their environment to deliver superior performance.  To this end, we invest over £7m per week into research and development and have over 200 live technology projects as well as 50 active research programmes with 40 universities.  We plan to spend £100m over the next three years on external technology investments and have pledged to invest £1bn in the development of next-generation battery technology.  There is plenty to talk about.About the Role Dyson is growing rapidly in SEA, in particular its eCommerce business. You will play a critical role in enabling this growth by owning Dyson’s online presence in the region. Your primary focus will be on Marketplaces and retailer.com; ensuring we are delivering an online experience that is both aligned with the brand and can deliver on its sales targets. Your stakeholders will include Group eCommerce, SEA Sales & digital teams and Distributors.Key responsibilities: Own the Dyson journey on marketplaces and retailer.com for SEA markets from the navigations to the Shop in the shop and product pages. Ensure Dyson technology is presented with quality and accuracy across the pages on marketplaces and retailer.com. This includes design content based on different platform capabilities. Ensure all new products, sales campaigns and product pages are published in time for the launch, aligned with market business leads. Be proactive and suggest ways to maximise brand visibility on the platforms, especially during new product launches and campaign periods. Work along with the local designer and distributors – from the development of wireframes to banner content. Work with the Group eCommerce team / APAC digital demand team to develop new content as and when required, to enhance the user journey. Working closely with the Digital Analyst to review onsite performance, to test, learn and implement optimisation. Set KPIs and ensure activities are optimised to achieve them  Regularly review and report competitors’ activities, pricing, search terms and market trends Lead the monthly call to share knowledge and raise support via digital retail community calls. About you Bachelor’s Degree in a related field required 3+ years content management experience required; experience with an eCommerce business Strong understanding of marketplaces and e-commerce platforms in SEA, such as Lazada, Shopee, Tokopedia, Amazon etc  Expertise in Webmaster, HTML, CSS Able to work independently Self-starter with lots of initiative; strong team player and ability to manage multiple stakeholders Passionate about the digital world and the opportunities UX &UI brings to drive traffic & sales Delivery focused and prepared to roll up your sleeves to make things happen Good communication skills, both verbal and written  Demonstrated strategic & analytical capabilities Highly meticulous and attentive to detail Enjoys working in a fast-paced & dynamic environment   Benefits Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition. #LI-DYSON Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity. Interview guidance We are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19. At this time all interviews will be conducted via video or telephone. We’re taking these precautionary measures to protect both our employee and candidate wellbeing. Our Talent Acquisition team will work with you and provide further information as appropriate.

About us If you own a Dyson product, then it contains embedded software developed by our team. Embedded software lies at the heart of many of Dyson’s products. The global scrum team’s work within the scaled agile framework, supporting Dyson engineers from concept to manufacturing in a dynamic engineering environment, using platforming techniques to develop connected products and graphical interfaces that change how our customers interact with our products. Constantly inspecting and adapting, the embedded software team is expanding and looking for enthusiastic and self-motivated C/C++ software engineers to join our team.About the Role Develop real-time embedded software for production consumer products on a range of silicon platforms, mainly ARM based. Involve/Lead product/system requirement document review and analysis, feasibility study and proof of concept. Involve/Steer software architecture and high-level design, as well as improvement of robust solutions and resolutions of technical challenges across projects/matrix structure. Responsible for low-level design, implementation/coding and software testing (unit/component/product level). Involve in continuous integration (CI) infrastructure/environment setup. Act as subject matter expert (SME) in specific domain, disseminating knowledge, guiding and mentor engineers in methodology, best practice and standards. Proactively identify technical risks within projects and influence engineering teams in their resolution. Challenge and develop best practice and process improvements within software team and across the wider RDD function. About you Bachelor Degree in (Electrical/Electronics/Telecommunication/Computer Engineering) or equivalent. Software development experience in requirement analysis, architecture, design, coding and testing of embedded system. Experience with C / C++, UML, Python. Experience in embedded real-time software engineering, e.g. FreeRTOS. Good knowledge of MCU/MPU architecture and its common peripherals. Experience in configuration and use of sensor devices over I2C, SPI, UART with DMA. Experience in on and off target test harness, such as Ceedling, Behave, etc. Good understanding of software development life cycles (Agile) and basic electronics hardware (interface to software systems). Familiar with embedded development tools (emulators, debuggers, analysers, oscilloscopes, etc) as well as configuration management tools and concepts. Knowledge of the Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence, bitbucket) would be an advantage. Candidates with the following experience are advantages. Bluetooth Low Energy protocols, including BLE 5.0. Ability to identify issues arising from the interoperability of wireless protocols such as BLE, Bluetooth classic and TWS. Experience of how to tune BLE / Bluetooth classic product behaviour to achieve product interoperability and high data throughput across a range of Dyson products. Exposure to one or more of the following: WiFi (802.11), NFC, ZigBee, 802.15.4, 3GPP, MQTT, Apple homekit. Knowledge of software security, LabVIEW, Linux-based embedded system. Excellent analytical and problem solving ability. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal); fluent in spoken and written English Independent and reliable, able to work with others within a scrum team, to ensure that the whole team succeeds in its goals. For a highly experienced candidate, we expect excellent technical leadership skills and the ability to influence the work of others. Experience in oversighting high complexity software development projects is an advantage. Benefits Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition. #LI-DYSON   Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique.
